pay out.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to pay a lot of money for something

pay out.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a company or organization pays out, it gives someone money as a result of an insurance claim, investment, competition etc
pay out.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Insurance companies were slow paying out on claims for flood damage.
pay out.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to let a piece of rope unwind
pay out.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to give a person or company money you owe, especially when it is a large amount
pay out.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Mutual funds are required to pay out a quarterly cash dividend.
The price increase was based on an analysis of the revenue that Chase receives and the fees it pays out.
